name: St. Syncletica of Alexandria
summary: Syncletica was one of the Desert Mothers, early Christian ascetics who lived in the Egyptian desert. She was a wealthy woman who gave away her possessions and lived as a hermit in a tomb near Alexandria. Her sayings and teachings on asceticism and the spiritual life were recorded and are part of the Sayings of the Desert Fathers. She is venerated as a saint and is an important example of women's role in early monasticism.
